item.title: Report X-2023060532
item.description:
Report X-2023060532

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-28T06:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: LINCOLN
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver found package leaking when it got to their van. They let the P&D manager know and he notified the Sort manager. Sort manager had an admin get the package and put in a hazmat tote to be taken to QA cage for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, the lids of the inner cans are both crushed and dented. One of them is leaking through the gaps between the lid and body of the can. Gap is on the top of the can and it is a smaller gap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat tote and taken to the cage for inspection. There are no contents in the van or anywhere else around where package was found.

item.title: Report E-2023050482
item.description:
Report E-2023050482

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-28T06:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: ADAMS
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 4, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum containing sodium hydroxide was damaged during transit and released approximately .25 gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted surfaces. EWI personnel overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon overpack, then deployed absorbents to the release. The crew utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all sodium hydroxide impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023050400
item.description:
Report E-2023050400

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-28T06:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: GRETNA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced an over the road release at while at a rest area of UN1197 Caramel FMF Liquid Conc Flavor from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 5' x 5' area of the trailer floor and concrete below due to a puncture. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the new impacted areas. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon poly totes. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Shelby, IA for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 12, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote containing corrosive liquid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Solutions, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the impacted surfaces. ESI personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all corrosive liquid impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023040131
item.description:
Report E-2023040131

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-28T06:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-06
  • City: SIDNEY
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Haz-Mat Response Inc. (HMRI) was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft- by-25ft area of the trailer floor and trailer bumper and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released from one 5-gallon metal drum due to improper securement for transport that caused the cargo to shift. HMRI personnel used absorbent pads to collect the material. HMRI personnel used a forklift to offload the trailer to clean the trailer floor and restack the undamaged cargo to forward on to the consignee. The spent absorbent pads and debris was placed into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum and was transported offsite by HMRI personnel to process for disposal.

Put it in a red hazmat tote and took it to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Inner drum does have some dents and scratches on it around the top rim. It must've leaked under the metal lid. Can't see crack. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a red hazmat tote with orientation arrows facing up to prevent release

item.title: Report E-2023020289
item.description:
Report E-2023020289

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-26T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-06
  • City: AURORA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XGN experienced a UN3082 "Hero Insecticide" release from a 250-gallon poly tote due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of product released to the asphalt parking lot in two areas measuring 130' x 12' and 200' x 1' and to the trailer floor in a 4' x 12' area. Crew confirmed the tote was punctured by the trailer wall. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into (6) 55-gallon closed top poly drums. Oil Dri was deployed to the impacted areas and worked in. Once all material was collected, all waste including the damaged cut up tote were collected and containerized into (13) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2022120955
item.description:
Report X-2022120955

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-16
  • City: NORFOLK

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was suspected to have leaked during unload due to a strong vinegar smell coming from it and was immediately secured in a HazMat tote. No liquid ever made it to the outer packaging of the box, it was all absorbed by the inner packaging. DescribePack: Cap of one of the inner 5 liter bottles was slightly loose allowing a small amount of liquid to leak out at some point, likely during unload. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured in HazMat tote. No liquid ever left the inner package.

item.title: Report E-2022120026
item.description:
Report E-2022120026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-26T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-29
  • City: SHELTON
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR GLOBAL LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 29, 2022, at 0830 ET, approximately 1385 gallons of Blitz 22 was released due to a single vehicle accident that occurred when the truck struck a deer resulted in a vehicle roll over. Haz-Mat Response were dispatched by ERTS to manage and oversee environmental operations. Upon arrival Haz-Mat Response personnel observed smoke and fumes that were blowing across the interstate to the south. Haz-Mat Response personnel donned PPE and began to transfer the remaining contents from the totes into new totes that had been delivered while the fire department hose down the totes. The transferred product was placed into 2-275 gallon totes, 9-225 gallon totes, and 1-300 gallon tote. One additional tote was generated with the rinse water. The broken totes were broken down and placed into one (1) roll-off box along with the debris from the trailer. The new totes were transported to the DOT yard in Shelton, NE along with the roll-off box to be staged for disposal. The median was secured by Haz-Mat Response personnel for future remediation.

item.title: Report E-2022120016
item.description:
Report E-2022120016

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

Report X-2022090852

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-26T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-18
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: manager saw wet hazmat walking the van line and had QA come take it away in a salvage drum DescribePack: QA found that one cap was loose on a bottle and tightened it DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: When it was found to be leaking QA tightened the lid and packed it into a salvage drum

item.title: Report X-2022090796
item.description:
Report X-2022090796

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-26T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-30
  • City: LINCOLN
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PH discovered hazmat package was wet and notified manager. they put the package in a plastic tote and placed it by the QA cage for inspection. DescribePack: small cut on the bottom of plastic bag closure. the leak size is very small. a small bead of liquid slowly leaks out every couple seconds. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was put directly into a plastic tote and flipped upside down to stop leak. leak was discovered by QA to be on bottom of inner plastic bag, so it was removed and is placed in tote so it won't leak.

  • Description: GBTX 1029 was found with a small drip coming from the bottom outlet and blind flange. Upon investigation it was found that the valve was not locked in position and the blind flange was not tightened sufficiently. Valve was locked into the closed position and flange tightened to tool tight.

item.description:
Report X-2022070795

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-07
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO BEING SHIPPED IN A MILWAUKEE TOOL CASE THAT COULD POSSIBLY CONTAIN A BATTERY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A LASER LEVEL WITH A LITHIUM ION BATTERY PACKED WITH THE EQUIPMENT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER CASE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER A75R46, PAK MAIL US327, 1704 N BELL ST., FREMONT NE 68025.
